ygData.subject: OOC Wrestling:
ygData.msgSnippet: OOC: Sigh again. It seems you pay too much attention to storylines. You didn t know what a mark is, marks generally don t. I don t like every Alliance member.

OOC: Sigh again. It seems you pay too much attention to storylines. You did=
n't know what a mark is, marks generally don't. I don't like every Alliance=
 member. I'm a large fan of Perry Saturn, Jerry Lynn, William Regal, Tajiri=
, and other WWF wrestlers. I just don't like certain ones. The WWF wants yo=
u to like the Rock, so you like the Rock. The Rock is definitely a babyface=
. Babyfaces play to the crowd, it's what babyfaces do. Rob van Dam is a bab=
yface, despite being on the side of evil. He plays to the crowd. Scotty Too=
 Hotty, while one of the worst, is definitely a babyface. Crowd playing to =
the max. Get all of that? Watch a Booker T match actually. Don't hate him b=
ecause the crowd does, that's markism. I don't like Jericho because the cro=
wd wants me to. If they tried to push Test as a huge heel, I'd hate him. if=
 they tried to push him as a huge face, I'd hate him. I don't care about po=
sitions, I watch their matches. Which Internet smarts generally do...

  --=
--- Original Message ----- 
  From: KSLawdogg@... 
  To: nbwrpg@yahoogro=
ups.com 
  Sent: Friday, August 17, 2001 10:37 PM
  Subject: Re: Cliffjumpe=
r & Strafe/Otyebis


  In a message dated 8/17/01 7:23:56 PM Pacific Daylig=
ht Time, 
  thecode@... writes:

  << OOC: A mark is someone who li=
kes the most glittery or overrated wrestlers. 
  IE you. The Rock, when he =
first came in, was jammed down everyone's throats. 
  RVD has also earned h=
is dues. DDP and Kanyon are 2 of the most talented 
  wrestlers today. Kany=
on knows moves, major advantage over Matt Hardy. I don't 
  care if he does=
n't spit in his hand. The majority of the good wrestlers are 
  placed in W=
CW ECW. You like WWF better, because they're good guys, and 
  therefore yo=
u cheer them on, much like what marks generally do. No shame in 
  that, bu=
t what I said is completely true and it's not worth arguing the 
  truth. P=
A: Booker T has been wrestling for 15 years now. HE'S paid his 
  dues... >=
>

  No...then I am not a 'mark'.  Who the hell comes up with these gay wor=
ds like 
  "bomdigity" and making "tight" into a meaning for "cool"?  When =
the Rock 
  first came into the WWF he wasn't the Rock.  He was Dwayne John=
son.  And he 
  was booed.  Then he was Flex Kavana.  And he was booed.  Th=
en he was Rocky 
  Maiva, and he was booed.  Then he became the Rock.  Then=
 because of this 
  great character he had made, he gained popularity and i=
s as great as he is.  
  He has charisma and personality.  He has great mov=
es and talent.  He's not a 
  babyface, by the way, he's a heel.  So you're=
 wrong about that.  The only 
  time I root for babyfaces is when they're r=
idiculously outnumbered and 
  someone is to much of a wuss to fight them. =
 Which, gee, the Rock always goes 
  in headfirst.  And I like bad guys maj=
orly, hence the whole Decepticon thing 
  with me.  In G1 they're trash-tal=
ked and always lose, but they're still cool 
  because they have attitude u=
nlike the mostly monotonic attitude of the 
  Autobots.  "They're in troubl=
e we must aid them."  But the Decepticons, 
  "They're in trouble, let's si=
t back and watch 'em burn!"  Rock isn't really a 
  bad guy, but he sure as=
 hell isn't a babyface.

  See, if you'd read what I type, you'd notice I t=
alked about the charisma and 
  moves.  Costumes aren't that important.  He=
ll, look at Kane.  What he's 
  wearing now is gay.  Before that he had it =
perfected.  I don't like the whole 
  biker thing with Undertaker.  But tha=
t's okay, because they make up for it 
  with skill and cool attitudes.  Th=
e WCW lacks those.

  If WCW or ECW were any good, they wouldn't have falle=
n.  They're just 
  breeding grounds for really good wrestlers like Stone C=
old and such who join 
  the WCW.  Only reason WWF superstars joined WCW is=
 there contracts would end 
  with the WWF and ol' Turner would be there wa=
ving muchos money in their face. 
   Booker T.'s been wrestling in what for=
 15 years?  He sure as hell sucks for 
  going that long.  

  The Rock has=
 NEVER backed down from a fight.  Everyone else has.  Stone Cold, 
  Kurt A=
ngle, Shane O'Mac, all of 'em.  That's part of the Rock's character.  
  He=
 won't back down, even if he gets the hell beat out of him.  Sometimes he 
=
  wins, sometimes he doesn't.

  -L. Unitron



   

  Your use of Yahoo! G=
roups is subject to http://docs.yahoo.com/info/terms/
